text:
Excellent coffee and lattes...They serve FONTE Coffee!
Hot cinnamon bun is delicious
Staff is welcoming and friendly.
If u want a decent cup of coffee then it's a decent option. If you want friendly service, then definitely don't expect too much. Almond milk is an option which is nice but like I said... It's just ok

Great place to pick up something quick. Husband and I came here every morning to get something for breakfast. Can be a pretty busy little spot.

Pasteries are beautiful looking and displayed in a case. The cinnamon roll, raspberry croissant, and blueberry muffin are yummy. Be aware: if you get an espresso with flavor, the flavor cost $1. I was a little shocked. Did it one morning and didn't order another espresso from them! :) 

You go to the counter to order yourself, get called when your food is ready or pick it up right when you order it. (Depends on what you order.) 

Seating is limited but watch for people getting up and have another person in your party go sit at it while you're in line.

We liked this Wynn cafe that serves as a coffee and breakfast eatery. 

After the pool on Saturday, got mocha frappuccinos here. They were damn good. Got some cookies as well that were decent. Service was warm and helpful. A more causal and laid back atmosphere. 

Saw they had a breakfast menu that we'll be trying on future visits. To be fair about it we didn't eat here. But hopefully soon.

I'm not too sure what to say about this place.  I mean it WAS 5am when I was drunkenly stumbling in to this place after a long night of partying at the nearby club.  But for some reason their food was not hitting the spot like other spots do in this same situation.  BUT it's the closest place with food and you can't buy shots here so its a good spot to try to sober up.  So for that, 4 stars.  If there was another situation where I was eating here... 2.5 stars.
This is a sweet little cafe.  The seating is cute.  Sure, it's not fine dining, but it hits the spot.  I had the tomato and mozzarella sandwich and was quite pleased.  I'll be back!
Tasty food options and delicious lattes... however quite pricey. $7 for a small latte?! Guess you get what you pay (if it's in the Wynn)

Too pricey, and does not offer a good coffee. As a daily homemade coffee drinker (not Starbucks), this shop provides a HoRRIBLe horrible coffee. I can't call it coffee at all. My cafe au lait taste like water with milk, the regular coffee taste like the brew has been sitting there for 24 hours. Eww!!! Never come back. Should have listened to my husband for breakfast buffet. Two stars because of the sitting area.

This place was a decent dinner for us when we first got into Vegas, considering every restaurant had a two hour wait...... we got the mozz basil tomato sandwich and then herb chicken sandwich.  Both were pretty good!  No line and the food came out fast!  Also got the exotic tart for dessert - this was pretty good too.  Was expecting more custard in the tart, but it was still good.  Great if you need a quick bite!

When I was here,  there was a long line,  but it seemed to go fairly quick. Once your order is taken, your food comes out quick since everything is more or less already prepared. I ordered the warm apple pocket. It was kind of bland and appeared that they rewarmed it. The rewarming process caused the pastry to lose its fluffyness. Don't get it even if it looks delicious.

My fianc√© ordered the breakfast bagel. It came with an everything bagel, sharp cheddar cheese, and ham. His bagel was delicious. I would definitely recommend getting this if you're in a rush and need a quick breakfast.
Met a friend at wynn. Needed a late night snack. Had a sandwich and salad. A little pricey but  hard to beat food this good especially at 11 at night. Good job wynn all the way down to the cafe.
We were able to pick up a quick last minute  sandwich and dessert at The Cafe at The Wynn Resorts prior to our Le Reve show.

A little pricey! But pretty good. Me and my sister came here after dinner for a cup of coffee, and to try something different. I ordered a regular white mocha with soy - came to about $7! That's more than a Starbucks cup! It is on the strip though, so can't expect much else I guess. It was a subtle hint of white mocha - I prefer a little sweeter usually - but it was still pretty good. 

We didn't have any food, but the portions were huge! Would definitely stop here again on a future trip to Vegas.

Had Fresh Berry Waffles with Applewood Smoked Bacon - waffles were cold but did have nice crisp - too bad they were cold. Bacon was hot not overdone.

They offer $21 unlimited sparkling wine, mimosas, or Bellini (nice that you can mix them up) - management could use extra care to make sure champagne glasses are free of water rim stains.

Atmosphere for Sunday brunch is appealing. Service staff is courteous.
Late night spot! Salmon bagel  is amazing. Lots of salmon too. Pretzel sandwich is also solid. Need to try Mac and cheese.

The Wynn cafe was super convenient and is open 24/7. I passed by it a few times but the line was pretty long so I waited till it died down a bit. 

I got a croissant sandwich with a strawberry smoothie which weren't cheap but the quality made it worth it. They have a large variety of different breakfast/snack foods and drinks. I left the cafe feeling really refreshed and ready to take on my day.

It's nice to have a casual place to go to at the Wynn. That said, the tomato soup I ordered last week came in a sort of cardboard tub (like for a pint of ice cream, not remotely elegant or even practical) and was so hot that ***it literally never cooled. For half-an-hour.*** Little plastic spoon, too. 

It was a miracle of nature, that hot soup, only I couldn't eat it without scalding my mouth.

Puffy cheese sticks on the side. I made do with those.

Excellent food for a quick bite place,  one of the best in a Vegas hotel that I've eaten at.  Better than the nice Red 8 Chinese place in the same hotel.  The tomato soup was really good,  super food salad was also really good.  Good selection.

Conveniently located good selection of coffees and pastries sandwiches etc 
Ran down to grab a latte and a muffin -$11.99

Has Steve Wynn dined here recently and secret shopped this place??? I'm surprised Wynn has this place in his resort. I pay more to stay at a nice hotel and expect nicer food along the way. When I pay $20 for sausage and eggs or lox and bagel I expect it to look just as pretty and well crafted as the hip, trendy plate I would receive back in LA that cost me $16. Sat at the bar today. Service was poor. The two girls next to us had to ask for silverware. My food came out looking like something I would expect at an average hotel restaurant, it was like warm and it was missing ingredients listed on the menu. 

Bartender was not on point I'm totally wondering how she got the job, no pre-bussing, Bloody Mary's took quite awhile. Overall super disappointed. We ate at Society for an overpriced breakfast yesterday and now it seems much more worth it compared to today. We stay at Encore when we visit Vegas but we won't dine here again. Blah. Ok, time to go drink at the pool.

I'm writing the review of The Cafe at the Drugstore while IN the Cafe at the Drugstore. Right after I just checked in at The Cafe at the Drugstore.

How meta!

I hate technology.
I wished they had more vegan options but the muffin and the chips and guacamole were delicious, It s a great spot to get something tasty on the go or sit since they have an inside seating.

Perfect spot for a quick bite if you're in the Wynn hotel or close by. They have a good variety of options. Sandwiches, salads, juices, coffees, teas and great looking pastries/desserts! I did have to think about that chocolate chip cookie with rice crispy squares on top though...which I did hold off on! Lol couldn't do it! However I have had the grilled cheese that comes with a cup of tomato soup before. And that was my go to, but last minute decided to switch it up and try the chicken mozzarella sandwich...and OMG!! I'm so glad I did! It was so tasty! It came warmed up, the bread was soft and the chicken was sliced thinly, the cheese was nice and melted, it also had some spring mix and tomatoes and a really tasty sauce! I for sure will definitely go back when I am over there again and just want that quick bite! It's open 24/7! That's a plus for those late nights!
I was super under-whelmed with my pasty and coffee. The upside is you can sit and people watch.

I stay at the wynn every year for work and we usually come here to get our morning coffee. The prices are crazy, its about $8 for my double soy latte with honey on the bottom, and its 2.90 for a single banana, the pastries are great but they are also pricey. Out of all the breakfast bagels I liked the Salmon one best, although I've never had the regular one because I dont eat sausage or bacon, and the veggie one is bland and sorta gross if you finish the whole thing. The only thing I get on the regular is tuna sandwich on croissant. I actually really like their croissants, they are huge and fluffy, but crispy.
Even though it's expensive, I guess it's still better then sitting down somewhere, it's a sorta quick, the mornings have huge lines, but sometimes you just want something quick! and in vegas you pay for it.

Decent cafe, located inside the Wynn, to go for a quick ready-made sandwich, limited choice of baked goods, soups, and soft serve. They serve coffee, espresso drinks, tea, and smoothies. Cheap compared to other choices nearby; however, still a few dollars more than what you would pay outside of the strip. Good place to just sit and chill pre-activity or post.

Soft-serve: tasted slightly weird to me. My 11-year-old cousin enjoyed its sweetness.

Coffee: Average - everything you would expect in a cup of joe is there.

Whenever I'm going to Tryst or XS and I'm waiting to meet up with friends in front or near the club, the security guards are always yelling "You can't stand here.  You have to keep it moving."  I know they're just doing their job but I'm waiting for people, damn it!  This is where The Cafe comes in handy.  Lots of little tables you can sit at while waiting.  But don't just go in there and take up a table.  Order an eye opening cup of coffee or have a yummy pastry.  A little expensive but it is The Wynn, so that's what to expect.  Cup of coffee was $3.50.  Pre-packaged cheese danish was $2.00.  Some of the food on the menu sounded good.  I'd like to try it next time.

I was doing some works up in my room when the hunger strike, and since I couldn't leave them for a long time, I decided to go down & quickly get something to eat. It was quite a long walk from my room, but since I was quite busy, its faster to walk & buy food from here than ordering room service and whatnot.

I was craving for some kind of salad because I haven't been eating much veggies since I got there the day before, so I got the caesar salad, which is about $10 with tax. The portion was HUGE and it was pretty good. Knowing crazy pricing around the Strip, this is definitely considered cheap & worth the money. If I were to stay in this hotel again, I'll be back to this place (And Zoozacrackers). I've had my share on good, expensive foods on the Strip, but I'm glad I found a nice eatery that doesn't care whether I dress up to eat or not. X)

During our stay at the Wynn we got coffee and pastries at the Cafe twice.  The specialty caramel coffee I got was fabulous... rivals the caramel macchiato at Starbucks.  Yum.  The pastries we got were ok, but clearly microwaved, which made them a bit soggy.  The Cafe is expensive, but no more than Starbucks really. If you're staying at the Wynn, and want some coffee or a quick bit, why not...

Breakfast for almost $16 was definitely not worth it...I ordered the orange juice and the egg and cheese flatbread. The orange juice was pretty good, but for the price...I could of definitely gotten two cartons at a grocery store. The egg and cheese flatbread was hard as a rock on the edges. The egg tasted very odd to me and on top of that, if you don't like yolk make sure to get egg whites instead. 

Overall, the service here was ok. The lines went quickly, but waiting on the food was treacherous, a lot of the customers weren't happy because they came out with all of our orders; instead of, giving the items one by one to customers. (Especially during breakfast on the weekdays...people are in a rush). This was my first time, and I definitely won't be coming back...I would suggest to go to a buffet instead for the price.

The stars are only for the atmosphere.  Love the decor and the location.  The staff were not very nice, my Pom berry ice tea was not very good, barely had any taste.  Orange juice was okay but for $10, it better be.  Overall it was okay, I might be back but we'll see :/

My friend decided to go here without me cause she couldn't take it anymore lol. I was looking for her at XS and she said she was here at the cafe. Its across from the Stratta and I ate half of her sandwich. It was ok, but fast and easy. ;)

I drunkenly ate my friend's food so I can't comment on the price and can't guarantee that my perception at the time was accurate.  But the mac and cheese was so good!!! That's all I remember about this place.

Friend confirmed that the mac and cheese was good.

I will come back here next time I go to XS...!

This place is known for their pastries and stuff. We had a group of girls, so we ordered a variety of pastries and things to share.

Egg & cheese flatbread: I actually didn't try this since I was too busy stuffing my face with the breakfast bagel...
Breakfast bagel: bacon, cheese, egg. You can choose the bagel flavor, I got the Everything Bagel. This was delicious and savory and filling. But that's how I like my breakfast...savory and filling. HA.

I think we ordered a variety of pastries (like croissant) and cups of fruit...which was really good. If I was in the mood for something lighter, I would probably get another croissant and a cup of coffee. It was just a little pricey, but that's what you get for a Vegas hotel cafe, I guess.

I wanted some desserts while I was visiting Wynn and the Drugstore Cafe was the nearest place in the building. There wasn't a line and the employee behind the counter was patient as I looked over the menu and the display case. When I had some questions, she answered them in a friendly tone. I ordered a Wynn Special Hot Chocolate, but with soy milk, and a Nutella Smores bar. It didn't take long for her to make my hot chocolate.

Both the hot chocolate and Nutella Smores were delicious. I'd say that the smores was actually too big for me, so I shared half of it with a friend.

The prices were a little pricey, but considering the portions aren't small, I thought it was okay. I'd definitely come back if I wanted more desserts while I'm at Wynn.

Had a quick bite here,  just before my friends & I headed on the road back home. Not expecting much, I ordered the brie and turkey sandwich on pretzel bread. 
I was not disappointed. It's not a gourmet sandwich but it was really filling. The turkey was not dry at all; the pretzel bread was really good, firm but soft, it was like a fresh made giant pretzel!!
The only bad part of my experience at this place, wasn't with the food, but with the service. The cashier/server, was really annoyed to help my friend and myself. I really don't know what her problem was or is, but isn't part of her job description help customer with a little bit of courtesy.
But I would still come back for a quick bite to eat....

Loved my suite at the Encore, did not love my meal at the Cafe.  I ordered a chicken portobello sandwich, fruit cup and a passion tea lemonade for 24$.  I found the sandwich very boring and bland. The chicken was dry and tasteless even with the mayo slathered all over it.  The fruit cup was typical.  The passion fruit tea lemonade was not bad but I like the Starbuck's version better.  Definitely not worth the price I paid. I definitely would go elsewhere.  Maybe try Society if looking for another cafe in the same hotel.

A nice change from Starbucks. 
Comparable with the national chains and less burn-y flavored coffee, all four people in our party enjoyed our coffee, tea, and pastries. The pastries in particular with well portioned and fresh without being overly heavy. We had carrot cake, raspberry coffee cake, and a mango coconut layered cake. 

The only down side to this place is it can get REALLY loud. It's the first place to eat coming out of  the Encore and Wynn theaters. Across the way is the far larger and busier Allegro. Between the two, the gaming floor opens up. So yeah, noisy!

The only other plus is it's LITERALLY less than 5 minutes walk from the entrance of the Level 2 self park parking garage.

If your staying at the Wynn or Encore this place is very convenient for breakfast, quick snack or lunch.  They sell coffee, tea, breakfast items, sandwiches, desserts etc. The price range per person is $10-$15 but then again your not eating at a fast food place and for Vegas it seems the norm.  
The food itself is pretty good and I think they are constantly making it fresh.  It was packed when Sam M and I got there at 11AM.  We were planning to do a Hoover dam tour and wanted to grab something quick to eat.  Sam M ordered the cinnamon bun, it was warm and gooey and so very good.  I ordered a tuna salad sandwich on a croissant and that was very prepared as well. The food came out in a timely manner and we had enough time to eat before we were on our way.  Good sitting as well inside the Drugstore cafe.~
This review is just for the tomato bisque soup, and must say it is my favorite! I'm not a big of tomato soups but I absolutely enjoyed this one especially on a rainy cold day.
Great Cafe Americano. Their Quiche Lorraine is really good and hearty. Other bakery goods look delicious as well.

This place is like the epitome of Las Vegas expensive.  But it's opened 24 hours and when you're drunk and hungry, you will fling your money to get something here.  We came here for breakfast/lunch before we headed home from Vegas.  It had a few choices of sandwiches and pastries.  I ordered the brie and turkey sandwich on pretzel bread.  I wasn't too big on the idea of the pretzel bread and so I asked if they could put it on a different bread.  silly me, I should have know it was premade and all they do is heat it up.  So, no, I had to eat the pretzel bread.  My sandwich consisted of the turkey, the brie and bread.  There was also honey mustard sauce on the side.  It was a sad $7.50 sandwich.  to wash it down, I ordered the large orange juice which cost the same as my sandwich.  WTF!  I shouldn't have expected too much.  I didn't.  Onto the next one.
Everything was freshly made and tasted great!  Nice snack place and great beverages.

Mmm mmm!  

Great option for late night dining on the go.   Everything is prepackaged, but it's fresh tasting and lots of healthy fibrous ingredients.  

Salads are ginormous and comes in a heavy duty plastic round container.  Ordered the Mediterranean Chicken Salad, $10 for: 

Cubes of chicken breast, feta, marinated veggies/olives, thinly sliced onions, and buttery avocado.  

The sandwiches are pretty standard.  The fresh fruit and salads are the best bang for your buck.

I also like to stroll through the drugstore portion of the store, and pick up the signature Wynn lemongrass scented lotion.  There's nothing else like it!

Great place to grab coffee or a small snack before seeing a show at the Wynn. An iced latte is a good pairing for a lemon bar or any other sweet treat they offer. The lemon bar is huge, definitely enough to share. They are creamy and not too tart. The decor of the cafe is on par with the rest of the hotel. Classy!
Awesome cafe that's open 24/7! Their tomato soup is delicious! Definitely my go to late night dinner spot

Had a very tasty heated croissant with almond and sugar sprinkled on to and a hot latte, the croissant was very big! and coffee/latte was also very good, set me back $13.
But it was a nice way to start the day. 
Also make sure to get  there before 9am to avoid the long line and wait.

Overall very good little cafe for a quick breakfast stop in the morning.
A little pricey tho.

Such random pricing. $6.75 for brie mac and cheese (good size, tastes great), but over $5 for a coffee drink and over $4 for a pastry. It's also the only place to get food after-hours at the hotel so consider it an emergency stop.

ALL I CAN REMEMBER ARE THE PRICES
(Warning: young adults from Central Florida in for vacation) Since we were often at the Wynn, we stopped here several times out of convenience. You are definitely paying for convenience and location. However as other friends noted, for a few dollars more than the price you pay here, it's a better value to just eat at the Wynn's buffet. 

DECENT SANDWICHES AND COFFEE
From the Breakfast Burrito to the Croissant Sandwich, Lox on a Brioche and the Coffee... everything was decent, not bad, but not memorable either. My belly was nicely filled but there wasn't much enjoyment in the flavors. 

SIDE NOTE ON THE DRINKS AND HOURS
This is the only 24-hour 'restaurant' at the Wynn which is pretty convenient and it's right in the main casino room. The Coffee side is able to make a good variety of brews. I noted 'Boba teas' were also on the menu- it was a bit out of place.

Even after long nights with my buddy Patron Silver did Cafe at the Drugstore suck big time. The lines were so long (at least 20 minutes) and the service was so slow. No sense of urgency on the staff and no efficiency.

So FINALLY I get my food and it sucked! First night I got a breakfast bagel - the bagel was chewy, the egg dry and the bacon semi-raw. The second night I get a pepperoni panini or quesadilla - they called it a panini but it looked like a quesadilla. The dough raw and sweet, the pepperoni was almost raw and non-existent, and the pizza sauce served with it was cold. Each of the above set me back over $10.

The Wynn needs another 24-hour place that is open when it is crowded. One would think that Mr Wynn would have thought of that. Also a place with table service should be an option.

I DO NOT UNDERSTAND why the Wynn has high ratings.

Solid spot at 4 a.m. Got a baked Mac and cheese - it was way too salty, but I was starving. I also got a juice (can't remember what kind) and was very disappointed. It was like $6 for the size of a Starbucks water cup and it wasn't even freshly made! She poured it out of a plastic bottle! 

Go to Zoozacrackers around the corner instead if you're looking for a quick bite.

I ordered the Italian Sub ($11.25) and it was delicious.  I also got the Coconut Mango Mouse ($6) which was so yummy.  I enjoyed every bite.  I prefer this over the buffet at the Wynn.  The service was great even with long lines.

Breakfast items are overpriced and ehh at best, but the convenient location justifies it. Don't come with high expectations.

Decent selection of overpriced pastries. The almond croissant was tasty, but the apple turnover was lacking in crispiness. Note: If you want your pastry warmed, you must ask for it. Depending on traffic, they may put it in the microwave instead of the oven. My apple turnover was popped in the microwave, so that may explain its depressed demeanor. 

The fruit and granola yogurt cup was actually decent. The granola seems to be made in-house and included pumpkin seeds (yum). No option for Greek yogurt for now. 

The line can extend out the door. It is located across Wynn's box office, so if you need  show tickets, pair up with a friend and tag team tickets and breakfast pick up.

3.5 Stars

Went here for breakfast to-go one morning and the place was bustling. They have a really good steel cut oatmeal for $5.95. It's expensive for oatmeal but considering the amount they give you (enough to feed two), it's a pretty good value. You get your choice of dried fruits and brown sugar. It was really filling, too. The oatmeal was just the way I like it, not too thick to the point of being gummy and not too soupy to the point of looking like it came from Quaker Instant. They also have expensive Forte teas here. I love Forte tea and they're a quality brand, but paying more than $3.00 for hot water and a tea bag that I have to fish out myself after 4 minutes makes my pocketbook wince. For these two items, I paid $10.00. If I'm ever back at the Wynn, I would come back for that oatmeal. It's hard to eat healthy in Vegas, so you might as well get at least one meal of the day right.

Before heading to Hoover dam, we stopped here to pick up things to eat on the bus ride.

We got two coffees,  mango jar, grilled cheese sandwich and egg white burrito.  Everything was tasty and fresh!  Although we enjoyed our food, they best part was the jar of mango.  It was mango puree with coconut milk mousse and topped with freshly cubed mangos.   Each spoonful was like heaven.

I love this spot and will definitely be back when we stay here next. 

If you want a quick meal, this is definitely the best spot!

The only place at the Wynn for a quick cup of coffee or breakfast/lunch. Service is pretty good and the food is pretty good, too. But, it's insanely overpriced. It was nearly 30 bucks for a capuccino, a bagel with salmon, a bagel with egg and a bottle of water. But, they've got the monopoly, so that's that. Thus, 3 stars. :)

Ok I was turned off when a breakfast bagel and coffee ran me 13 bucks, but boy the bagel was fresh and made well. Great ambience too and a good spot to hang out and watch people into the casino. Definitely a good place for an evening coffee or a morning bagel.

Interesting names these places inside casinos have. Drugstore Cafe? 

Anyhow, the line was pretty long, but the wait time wasn't too bad. We ordered a small smoothie and it was very pricey. On top of that I ended up throwing it away after finishing about 1/4 a cup because it was way to sweet and artificial tasting. I wouldn't make an extra trip to go back. Maybe the other items on the menu are better?

This is the only "affordable" and non-sit down place to eat at the Wynn which frustrated the hell out of me since this place didn't meet my high expectations of what should be in the Wynn.

 The first meal I had here was the ham and cheese panini which they served to me cold in the middle; the cheese wasn't even melted. When I took it back they reheated it and it was STILL cold in the middle. I just gave up after that because it was 3:00AM, I was partially drunk/hunover and just couldn't care enough to make a stink.

I had breakfast and snacks here throughout my stay and I'd have to say my favorite things to eat here were the steel cut oatmeal and bran muffin. Pastries here were pretty decent.  All the other stuff was just not worth the inflated Vegas prices.

Post XS grubbin'

I tried their Mac & Cheese w/ Chicken and it was quite possibly the best Mac & Cheese I've ever had... but unfortunately I came here looking for a late lunch meal  and the serving for this is TINY. The portion is at least 1/4th the portion they give you at a restaurant. 

I then came here again after leaving XS and tried the tomato soup w/ cheese sticks. The cheese sticks are super delicious- hot, fresh and tasty. The soup was good and the portion was just right. 

The decor of the cafe is really cute! Oh and the huge cake slice is DELICIOUS. The cake is fluffy and mousse like- just don't eat it all by yourself or you will probably not fit into your short tight dress for clubbing.

When we first arrived the line was long but in true style the staff moved the line along quickly. Dining area seemed full but by the time we received our food several tables had cleared. Menu was primarily light fair u had yogurt parfait with granola and a croissant both of which were equally delicious.

This is probably the most beautiful coffee shop in the entire world.  I like the ambience, the good architecture and artwork that adornes this coffee shop.  Some people have complained about the high prices here.  Yes, the coffee is expensive, but you are drinking this coffee in a five-star, five-diamond resort.  If you want cheap coffee, go to McDonald's.

Yes, the Wynn is expensive. If you're going to eat in any of the cafes and restaurants here you just have to accept it. And if you're exhausted from a night of gambling you probably won't have the energy to wander very far for a bite to eat in the morning. But that being said, I felt like I *almost* got my money's worth with the veggie breakfast bagel. It was huge! There must have been around 4 egg whites in there. It was a tad bland since it was basically poached egg whites with a bit of spinach, but it was fine with a touch of salt, and totally filling. They also have a sausage or bacon breakfast bagel if you're so inclined. 

At $8ish it was a good deal for a simple, quick breakfast compared to the Terrace Pointe Cafe which had more elaborate breakfast choices for double the price. If you can wait until 10 am, Sugar & Ice (towards the end of the shopping esplanade) also has some cheaper breakfast options, though I didn't have the chance to try any of them.

The Drugstore is located at the casino level of the Wynn and open 24 hours.  It has the usual variety of items you forgot to pack for your trip, as well as a wide selection of boutique bath and body products, candles, souvenirs, AND (listen up) a cafe that serves espresso and coffee drinks, breakfast pastries, desserts, sandwiches, soups and salads.

The $9.95 half-sandwich and soup deal goes on the "value" list.  The flank steak roll-up with kalbi dipping sauce was a great light meal, although the chicken noodle soup had that extra-special salty punch a la Corsa next door.  5 stars for the Jones Organic Red Tea -- Tropical, which came in a bottle and was highly refreshing.  I'm hoping the organic cane sugar will counteract the need for high blood pressure meds.  Just kidding.

For vegan guests: there is soy milk options for all coffee drinks. There's a vegan cranberry orange muffin. Fruit salads, bananas, etc. The bagels are not vegan last I checked. The line is usually very long, but it's the only centralized coffee place in the resort.

I've been to this place what feels like hundreds of times over the years. Doing events at the Wynn, site visits, whatever whatevers... it's hard to not spend some time at the Drugstore Cafe. Coffee is solid - but expensive. Tea selection is great (Tea Forte) but expensive. Food is actually pretty good but, yup, you guessed it, kind of pricey. My go to used to be the house made oatmeal in the morning, but they've replaced it recently with some packed in a cup nonsense that I want no part of, so I have to head to Tableau for the oatmeal. However, this evening I wanted something to eat but nothing huge and took my chances. Got the chicken noodle soup and the chicken/mozz sandwich. It was busy but not nuts, but there was a line up behind me so I was conscious of not being one of those people - you know the kind that you end up behind at Starbucks during a busy lunch rush who have never ordered a single cup of coffee in their lives and ask about the intricate differences between an americano and a latte or whether or not the person at the register recommends using almond or coconut milk in their gluten/dairy/sugar/taste-free beverage - but I did ask what was in the sandwich, promptly requested the olives be removed but please do heat it up and went on my way. Service was solid, she was super friendly and sent me on my way to wait for my food. When I say this is up there with one of the best chicken noodle soups I've ever had, it's no lie. This is really good soup! It may almost be worth the $8 I spent (side note - that oatmeal I covet and miss was also around that price, so whatever, right?). Chicken sandwich will have to wait until I come down from this chicken noodle soup high! Also try the coffee cake - it's got a berry thing happening in it that's pretty awesome. And the Wynn hot chocolate is AMAZING but rich, prepare yourself for that in advance.

Ummm, I have come here countless over the past few days and I am consistently impressed with the quality level of the food- just as I should be for the astronomical prices!!  However, it was fast, prompt, service with a smile and they really do a nice job.

For breakfast their parfait is good and the fruit cup is fresh!  The croissant is the size of my head and is buttery, flaky goodness.  Muffins are moist + Great coffee selection!!  The line is out the door on most mornings that big conventions are in town, so if you catch yourself running short on time, just turn the corner (heading towards Encore from the Wynn) and you will find a very clever kiosk with a few quick- choice selections to go!! Genius!!

For lunch I tried their Roasted Chicken Sandwich with Kalamata olives, arugula and a lemony pesto dressing and let me tell you, I'm actually craving it right now for lunch as I write this review!  Chicken was very moist and the roll seemed fresh baked.  My friends also enjoyed their turkey sandwich and the salads & pastries as well!  

Great quick option I the Wynn but you will walk out spending on average $15- $20 for a "meal" each time!!  That's what happens when the small bottle of "Wynn" water is over $3...

Glad this place is there and close to the hotel elevators. Convenience for a coffee at any time of day (24/7 hours) is the only perk. 

The food here is sub par. Breakfast bagel is so blah. The bagel itself is heavy and tasted like wood chips. Never mind the price. It is expensive to buy anything here, as expected, but why not make things a bit more appetizing? I don't even want to try any of the baked goods. Although, those layer cakes look tempting. Looks can be deceiving though.

It is connected to the overpriced convenience store, so grab your $3.51 small plain coffee, and cut through that part of the shop to exit to avoid the ballooning lineup at the cafe door.

24-hour cafe bing bing bing! I got an herb roasted chicken sandwich, smelled like pizza and tasted better than pizza! The chicken was juicy & tasty :) also, they're regular coffee was worth the price and the hangover curer ;) 
But the 5 stars goes to the customer service! For a quick stop, the workers make sure you are accommodated. Very friendly, I felt special being referred to as "Miss Leslie" hehe overall great, healthy food options. And the chocolate cake we got for our friends birthday was perfect!

This is a little pit stop cafe in the middle of the Wynn Casino. It's a cool place to stop in for a coffee drink and small snack. It always seems packed with people but you can find a seat most of the time. The food is ok & reasonable priced, but nothing special (they have a spicy chicken tortilla soup I love but it's only served during certain months) and nice yogurt parfaits. The coffee drinks are a bit overpriced but taste nice. Good place to meet up with friends after a long night out or have a quick breakfast before leaving vegas.

Definitely on the pricey side but the lovely ambiance, including the whimsically chaotic decor and the friendly service, makes up for the steeper prices. My mom and I ordered an ice coffee ($3.89), a carrot cake ($6), and a magic cookie bar. The carrot cake was moist and flavorful, while the magic cookie bar ($5), although a bit too sweet, was made with high-quality chocolate and had fresh walnuts and coconut shavings.
If you want good coffee, keep on moving. If I made coffee like this not only would it be free, but I'd apologize to those accepting.
Food was not as good as a Starbucks. Premade breakfast flatbread that was overcooked and lacked any flavor. Again, everything in Vegas is expensive, but at least give us a good meal.

First time here, so I decided to try a variety of items: the super huge marshmallow chocolate chip cookie, the tiramisu, and the peach pear thai tea with boba. 

I should've known better...Wynn does not know how to make adequate boba. I knew it was strange to see boba milk tea on the menu and was planning on ordering some sort of coffee drink initially, but I gave in to mu curiosity. I felt super ripped off to have paid $8 for this drink that didn't even taste good. Ix-nay on ever ordering that again! NO to boba at the Wynn!
 
The tiramisu comes in a plastic jar and is pretty good. It's sorta pricey at $8, but it was a much better value than the boba tea drink. 

The standout of the order was definitely the cookie. It's the biggest cookie I've ever ordered and at $5.99, it's a steal! It's soft, not too sweet, and still tastes fantastic and soft a week later!

There's very limited seating with people hogging the tables, so definitely grab your stuff to go. There's a counter with standing room only for 6ish people by the area where you pick up drinks if you want to use it to get all your stuff together before you head out or to try your drink to make sure it's right.

Find Drugstore Cafe towards the back of Wynn right by the gift shop.

Steve Wynn, this place needs a serious overhaul. I don't mind paying for quality, or even paying Vegas prices for something decent, but this place was both terrible and expensive -- a serious no-no in my book. 

I had a simultaneously dry and mushy (dunno how that works) chocolate muffin and a tasteless mocha. The mocha had little espresso, little chocolate, lots of milk, and very little sugar. If I'm ordering a chocolate muffin and a mocha, I need a damned chocolate fix Mr. Wynn! Your place did not deliver. Especially at the total of $12. 

My boyfriend had a cup of watered down coffee and a mediocre (somewhat below Starbucks quality and size) yogurt parfait for $10.50. He didn't like it, and I didn't like feeling like a complete fatty for what he ordered. I know this last part was entirely my problem, but you weren't getting more than 1 star anyway so I'm throwing it in as a freebie.

I really enjoyed the almond croissant and cappuccino for breakfast here.  It was kind of pricey ($8 for a croissant) but it was large, topped with powdered sugar and delicious - went very well with the cappuccino.  Great place if you need to stop by for a quick bite to eat in the morning if you don't want to opt to do one of the large buffets.

This is a super place to grab a bite at any time of day, as it is open 24/7. My folks came here often during their recent stay for sandwiches at lunch-time, and I went once with them. It was extremely busy so I might opt to go at off times in the future and avoid the lunch crowd. The place is small so we had to wait for a table. Essentially, you place your order at the counter, pay, sit at your table, and they call your name when your meal is ready. Since it was busy, the staff were calling out a lot of names to pick up their orders. It was reminiscent of that old SNL skit (deli counter staff barking: "Burger, burger, No COKE! Pepsi for you!").

The food is really good. As mentioned, my folks had various sandwiches here. I had a fruit and cheese platter that came with small cups of peanut butter for dipping, as well as a gourmet granola bar which I saved for the flight home (that platter had a LOT of food! And it was not expensive, too). 

This was a really convenient and reasonable go-to place for a quickie meal. If I were staying longer (and boy, I sure wish I could!), I'd be a regular patron here.

Ya this place is pricey, but it's Vegas...you're gonna spend $$$ on food. That being said, the food is YUMmy! I got the asian chicken salad and it was delish!! And only $10!  

And then there's cake. Oh the cake. It is freaking amazing. Your taste buds have not lives until you have tasted this cake. We got the strawberry shortcake, it was fluffy and moist and heavenly. AND I don't feel like I'm gonna pass out from a sugar coma after eating it! I am seriously having a relationship with this cake. Just get it, trust me.

Love this place. Kinda pricey for "cafe grub" but it IS Vegas and you ARE at the Wynn. Just sayin. 

I love how it's open 24hrs! So whenever I was craving a mango smoothie with a antioxidant boost at 4am, I could walk here and get me one!

Everything here is yum! The salmon bagel I had was on point! Huge pieces of salmon and the capers add a nice touch. My fam kept ordering the tuna croissant saying it was "hella good" so I'm guessing that's a favorite. The bran muffin here was the best bran muffin I've ever had. Also had the Nutella s'more. Not the best. It's alright. Wouldn't recommend it if you really want the Nutella flavor. Kinda just tastes like chocolate. 

But overall, love this cafe! Would definitely come back. 

Ps. No dress code like most restaurants at the Wynn. So men in your tank tops, you're good to go.

Literally a life saver. 

1. It's right next to the room elevators. 
2. It's open 24/7!
3. Coffeeeee!
4. Ice creaamm!
5. Alcohol, snacks & more. 

I don't think I've ever stayed here without visiting the drugstore at least once a day.

Good place to go for an inexpensive snack after a night of partying or gambling as this place is open 24 hours. Inexpensive for Wynn, that is. Expect to pay over $10 for a sandwich and $5 for a drink. Everything here is convenient- the sandwiches come pre-made and are warmed to order in a convection oven; the salads come pre-made as well; the soups are in a large pot; and the desserts come from the refrigerator. The only thing that is made-to-order are the drinks from coffee to tea to smoothies. There's also frozen yogurt and various baked goods (cookies, brownies, etc). This cafe is convenient (reflective of its name)- you order at the counter, get your food and then find a place to sit. 

The food is pretty good, some items better than others. I've tried the Pepperoni Pizza Pocket, the Philly Cheesesteak, the Chili, the Asian Chicken Salad, and the Fruit Tart (Not all at the same time though!). My favorite was the Fruit Tart- a delicious pastry shell filled with pastry cream and topped with a beautiful arrangement of fruit (Strawberries, blueberries, raspberries, pear, apple, lychee, pineapple, mango, kiwi...). It was a pretty good size for $8. 

But like I said, if you're hungry in the middle of the night, are stuck at the Wynn/Encore, and have no money because you gambled it all or spent it all on drinks at XS or Surrender, then this place will be your savior.

I came here for a quick dinner bite after a really late lunch of breakfast foods. Confused yet?

I was drawn in by the brie mac & cheese with chicken. I can't remember how much it cost, but it was pretty cheap, maybe like $6.50? The portion is pretty small though. It was pretty good, but kind of made me think of baby or little kid food because the chicken was cut in little cubes and the noodles weren't macaroni, but little rings. The real winner though was the asian chicken salad which was one of the best I've had in a while.

An ok place to drop in for coffee (and incredibly overpriced smoothies) or pastries, but not really a dinner type place. They have a pretty good selection of desserts though and I was definitely eyeing the ginormous $12 slice of cake. There's always next time!

I love the ambience at this coffee place.  The coffee is acceptable and the food is good.  The prices are very high.  The best part of this place is the location and the ability to do lots of people watching in the casino.

I was looking for a quiet place to study during my stay at the Wynn. I came across this gem, which is extremely convenient considering it is connected to the Wynn convenience/drug store.  If you're staying at the Wynn, it is even better because you literally turn the corner right, after getting out of the elevators and you're there! 

24-hour cafe: I think they serve everything on their menu at all times of day, which is perfect if you're on a crazy Vegas sleep-eat schedule. If you're looking for the quietest time to get some serious work done, go between 2am-6am. 

I would give 4 stars, but despite the convenience, the cafe and adjoining drug store are a bit pricey. (Then again, it is the Wynn, so that is expected, right?). My suggestion, if you're looking to have a good meal, it is better to go and eat at one of the multitude of buffets in Vegas. But, you can eat a variety of sandwiches and croissants/pastries here if you're looking for something on-the-go!

Enjoyed the massive size macaron. However, they got rid of their aged cheese plate (which was great to take up to the room to enjoy with a nice bottle before heading out) and replaced it with a poorly made, lacking in freshness meat and cheese plate. Mediocre cheese and meat. Weird oversized olives. Four or so crackers on the side. Boooooo!

I go to this cafe for a snack or drink. The lines get long here. I get the white mocha ice blended. It's great for the hot weather in Vegas. Their fruit smoothies are too sweet. Sometimes I'll also get a chocolate chip cookie or eclair from their fresh pastries.

Staying at the Encore. Some nice things about the Encore. Some not nice things.

Nice things: People. Well trained and polite, and polished.
Not nice things: MUST WALK A COUNTRY MILE TO GET A DAMN CUP OF COFFEE TO GO. 

People, if you're going to make me leave my room for a cup o' joe, and insist that I pay double the going rate for coffee to go, could you maybe NOT make me schlep so damn far for the priviledge?  

Really missing the Mandarin and Four Seasons. Wynn isn't bad, but the "Miles to go until I drink my coffee" thing is a huge downer... plus broken lamps and no Kleenex. 

:(

This was actually a really good spot...I tried a few different items and everything was good:

-Turkey Sandwich/Panini
-Breakfast Bagel
-Brownie
-Cinnamon Roll

It's hard to believe a random, casual caf√© in the Wynn would have such good food...I guess because it's the Wynn, only the best.  Be warned, however, it is pricey!

Ok coffee, but the worst biscotti I've ever had.  Imagine stale corn bread dunked in coffee. They used to have these big marvelous tasting biscotti, I liked them so much I would buy a dozen to take home. I wonder if they knew how bad they were, would they continue to sell them....????

This is a quick service food option that fills its role well. We ate here for breakfast and it has everything from pastries to simple warm breakfast sandwiches. Since its in the Wynn, the look of the place is very sleek and attractive like its surroundings.

Usually when we go down for breakfast in Vegas before 9:30 AM we get the run of the place. However, on this trip we were surprised by how packed this place was! There are plenty of tables but they were all full so we brought breakfast back to our room. I got an almond croissant and regular butter croissant with orange juice, and my husband got the chocolate croissant with water. The croissants are enormous, but they are a bit too crunchy on the outside for my liking. Even so, this is a great option of a place to have if you need to grab something quickly.

Good place to have a cup of Joe and sandwiches. The sandwiches were very tasty and service was very good. They have a few pastries that are goo as well. The soups are very tasty. Definitely a go to when staying in Wynn

So uhhh apparently this is open 24 hours, but the menu gets increasingly limited as the night goes on. I came in around 2am and the only things left in the display were some sandwiches, fruit parfait, and that mac and cheese in a cup. 

Don't come here late, and i'm sure the options are way better. 

To their credit, my $7 granola, yogurt, and fruit cup was not bad.

Just ate at this cafe recently in January 2015 and still is one of my favorite cafes to go to in Vegas.  I'm sure for those who have eaten an asian chicken salad before, you're probably like what would make this asian chicken salad so different from everywhere else? Well it's the dressing!  I have tried many asian chicken salad dressing but nothing will ever top this place!  

The cafe is a little pricey but it's worth every dollar.
Had a delicious Grilled cheese and tomato soup...really hit the spot. It was a bit pricey though..for 2 of them it was $36.00.
This place was decent. If you like coconut try the magic cookie. My wife got the tiramisu, which she said was good.

Service was TERRIBLE here. I'm surprise how poor the customer service is here and how extremely slow the service is. The employees were very rude and unfriendly. N one is accountable for their actions and no one here, including the Manager knows how to acknowledge customer's frustrations and handle situations properly. We were waiting in line and the cashiers helped two other people who were NOT in line before us. They totally skipped us and the employee who saw us and told us to wait our turn in line proceeded to allow people who were NOT in line to order. Apparently they like to claim that there is a line but then they will take anyone who walks up to the register and disregard people who are actually in line. When we brought this to their attention, they were very defensive and unkind. The manager at the Cafe allowed the problem to escalate and left us feeling very frustrated.  The manager at the Cafe was unapologetic and RUDE. We just wanted to get our coffee prior to enjoying Le Reve. We definitely will not be coming back to this place!

One of the hidden gems of Wynn.  I passed by this place all the time and never stopped in until my sister said hey you know what?  They have awesome food inside.  I was skeptical.  Food inside a deili like drug store?  Ok why not, we were in a hurry.  

I ordered their Asian Chicken Salad, Carrot Cake Muffin, mix berries parfait and coffee.  

It's really good food!  Service is fast, it gets a tad crowded and you may not be able to find a seat inside but pick up your food and go sit poolside and enjoy.  Everything we ordered (mentioned above) were very good.  Here's the kicker though... PRICEY.  Yes Pricey!  Did you expect less from Steve Wynn?   To give you an idea of the price here, a small 8 ounce cup of parfait cost me $8. 

It's one of my favorite places to go pick up food in the morning to sit poolside.  Just expect to pay double what you would at an other cafe or deli.

The review is based on their desert only !
If you love macaroons then stop by and get raspberry lychee one ! It's heaven! Soft and chewy and perfect amount of sweetness with a little sour twist! I could have easily eaten 3-4 but of course I didn't since I want to come back again. I guess see you tomorrow :)
Expensive for breakfast but fast and convenient.  Great coffee and the granola/yogurt was tasty.

I kept coming back here to eat when I was staying at the hotel. It's conveniently located at the corner across from the black jack/ craps tables,and the sports betting TV area. It's super spacious with lots of seating and connected to the drugstore on the other side. 

First thing I had here was the Chicken Noodle Soup which was good, but nothing special. My friends had the Brie Mac-N-Cheese which came in a small cup. They loved it. The second time I had the Caprese Salad Sandwich that I loved and kept coming back for more.. Their desserts looked great.

The place is kind of pricey, but it's a pretty good place to go if you're hungry and don't know where to go. Very casual grab a bite to eat and go. It's open 24 hours I believe since i walked in hungry at 4 AM, so that's a plus!

I had the most wonderful, beautiful french macaroons here after the Spamalot show. And they're all made in house, well of course, this is in the Wynn after all. We tried the chocolate and the pistachio. I wish I bought more because I know how time consuming they are to make, and if you have a temperamental oven, forget about it. Unfortunately they don't travel well, and if you travel with me and my hubby, I'd have to say they'd never reach their destination as we'd eat them all. I can't say much about the savory food here, but as far as the sweets are concerned, so many of them to choose from, I'm sold. Also, it's truly a quaint little cafe set up with a "drugstore" next door, basically selling your usual gargantuan hotel goods...anti static spray anyone?
As D.D. says the "breakfast bagel is blah." So skip that and have a yummy baileys coffee...worth the 8 bucks.  We also tried a greek salad on another day and that was worth the $10.75.

Cute cafe for quick bite. Don't set expectations high. Quality of food is similar to microwaveable and/or vending machine food. Prices are average being located at Wynn. Bagel with cream cheese and a toasted-microwaved breakfast bagel (pre-made) 2 small coffees and a half cup of fruit $25. Stop by if drunk and hungry no where else to go during late hours.

We had the roast beef sandwich and Asian chicken salad.  Both were good but somewhat overpriced.  The dressing on the salad was especially good.  It contained a small chicken breast and soba noodles.  

When I say overpriced, the 12 ounce diet coke was $3.99 and would have cost less than $1.50 outside.  Being captive should not mean price gouging.

probably the most affordable out of all the overpriced(although common on-the-strip) restaurants at Wynn and Encore. 

Chowder Bread- it's a cafe so don't expect much. not bad but can be 2 star better.
berry parfait- had this as a snack and supper for the next 3 days. granola wasn't that crunchy but everything still tasted perfect. this is the first time i had it and definitely is my 1 out of 1,000,000 tries.

Cute and friendly cafe that's conveniently located in between Wynn and encore. The coffee was very good and extra foamy, just how I like it. One of the best cup I've had; or I was too hungover to have proper judgement. I also got a soup but that was a bit bland for my liking. I wish I had the appetite to try the croissant and macaroon... Next time perhaps.

Very nice find in the colossal Wynn tower's maze of shops and dinning places. Earlier in the day, we had buffet breakfast at wynn's buffet place. While the buffet was great - it felt like being at a cruise ship's dinning hall; several stations, lots of people, and plenty of food. For lunch, I wanted something more personal so went to this place and were not disappointed.

They have several veggie options and we were told that their fries are also vegetarian (they don't fry meat in the same fryers). The soup was also vegetarian with no beef or chicken stock. I ordered a veggie pita pocket which was light with fresh vegetables and nice honey mustard sauce. Fries were seasoned, crisp, hot, and yummy. 

Very friendly and attentive staff answered all our questions and kept up with timely refills. In fact, we had a breakfast the next day at the same place and enjoyed that as well. Their breakfast servings are huge (see pics) so bring a good appetite! Very happy to have found this place.

Asian chicken salad is sooooo good. Anytime I or someone I know is in Vegas I always make them stop at the Wynn for a couple salads to bring me home. Omg. I can't get enough of them. They're to die for delicious!

Nice, cozy cafe to drop in and grab a variety of foods and drinks they have! They have foods from breakfast sandwiches to smoked salmon to baguette sandwiches. For drinks they have everything from smoothies to coffee to even boba! It was a pretty busy line when we came in but it moved fast! 
We got the sourdough grilled cheese, tomato soup, mozzarella & chicken sandwich, and smoked salmon bagel! All of which were pretty delicious! Heads up thought that almost everything is pre made! And the prices were pretty high for a meal they just heat up. 
4 stars because the service was just okay!

I can't believe how few people mention the croissants from this place?  As good as those I've had in Paris plus 5 times the size.  This is the Drugstore Cafe's best kept secret.  I guess they don't always have them out on display so you have to ask for them in the evening or outside breakfast hours.  We're from Utah and anytime we pass through Vegas on our way to SoCal we stop just to pick up a few!  (and then again on the way home)  Please people, if you know of another amazing croissant place in the western US I'd like to know.  But I doubt they have anything on the Wynn's excellent croissants.  Their other pastries are average at best.  And yes you pay 5-6$ per croissant but who cares when its perfect and these are huge. (perfectly flaky on the outside airy and moist on the inside.  Melt in your mouth perfection.  Thank you Steve Wynn.

Ordered Wynn coffee, almond croissant & raspberry coffee cake..

Have to say.. The pastry really worth its prices.. A almond croissant comes slightly bigger than my hand, and tastes very good.. (I'd go back every morning/afternoon to try others not if I have to watch weight).. 
The raspberry coffee cake is big enough for 2.. For me, it was too sweet & sour (at same time), so I only had a small portion with coffee of course.. but some people may like it as it is.. 

Lastly, the coffee tasted okay/nice.. Maybe a little pricy, and not too strong for the morning.. But personally, I like strong taste, it wakes me up! 

Definitely returning for the salad & sandwich as they look real yummy!

Stopped by for a quick dessert before watching Le Reve. 

Bought three frozen yogurts for my parents and I and we were extremely disappointed. For $5+ each, they were a terrible buy. My dad said his vanilla tasted like plastic. My chocolate one tasted more like ice than dairy. 

Waste of money at this cafe

If your staying at the Wynn and in need of a coffee fix and not have to run across the  street for Starbucks. Wynn has their own cafe spot at the casino level. 

I'm an iced coffee guy but they didn't have much to offer on flavor selection, just the basics like caramel, vanilla. So I've went for their Iced Cafe Mocha. It's not too bad, it tasted chocolatey but not too much on the buzz. 

What's really worth getting here is their chocolate chip cookie. It's thick and delicious to the last crumb. It may not be freshly baked but once you unwrap it you'll be munching like the Cookie Monster. 

We got here around 10 p.m. and the place was everyone's central perk, there were a lot of people hanging out here. You will also see pastries on display which didn't look all that appealing to me. 

If your staying at the Encore you would have to walk some distance to get to this place, since the Wynn is connected here.

Very pricey but I enjoyed what I got. The cinnamon bun is tasty and tasted like it had a stick of butter in it. Yum!

The cheesecake tastes like its made of mostly cream cheese which I like

My sisters and I were so hungry, we had to grab something quick before the show. We ended up ordering the chicken sandwich, phili steak and Caesar salad. The sandwiches were good, but a tad bit cold even though they popped it in the oven. I found out that they premade all their sandwiches in the morning, which I didn't like at all. I really like my sandwiches to be made fresh.

The Caesar salad was okay (2 stars) because the dressing was horrible, had an awkward taste to it. 

Pricing wasn't too bad, around $12 or so per item.
Had the tomato soup and cheese sticks. Hot, delicious and great value for money. Great vegetarian option.

Nachos at 3am sounded like a great idea, and they were actually quite tasty. What wasn't so tasty was waiting in line for 45 minutes at that hour with the rest of the crowd swaying after too many drinks. How's about upping the staff?

We ate here a few times while staying at the Wynn. We ate a variety of items. Overall the food is great. Downsides: The service is ALWAYS extremely slow and there is always a line. They really need more people working however the staff who are there are friendly and seem to be hustling. We were there during New Years holiday. They have three registers and typically only one working, and sometimes two.
The prices are high for example about $11.00 for a cold cut Italian sub. We got our meals to go several times and seems like they don't give you a full portion for carry out. This place is Ok to eat at if staying at the Wynn but wouldn't make a special trip. Typical wait was about 20 to 30 minutes to get carry out food that is already prepared and just needs heating up.

You've just been partying for 12hrs straight. It's 6am in the morning. You're hungover, hungry and in need of a little pick-me-up.

Head over to this little cafe nestled in the Wynn. It's open 24hrs. Like the other reviewers say, its a little pricey but it's Vegas... isn't everything?

The pre made sandwiches are pretty tasty though - especially the  breakfast bagel which was my favorite. The staff could do with smiling a bit more but I guess having to put up with our drunken arses wasn't the easiest of tasks.

I really love this cafe. Yes, it's expensive, but come on. It's Vegas, what do  do you expect? I came to the cafe after a late night showing of Le Reve. I was looking for a place to get a quick meal before heading upstairs to the room. I decided to get a turkey sandwich and the fondue platter thing:

http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/Do4n_yK_K6DmR9_Es5qwlA?select=B1QFcByJi2lpQGAGsdv5HA

The sandwich was really good. The bread was really fresh. I liked it so much that I brought another one for the plane ride home. The fondue thing was cute. It tasted okay.

2 stars

Stopped by after lunch so my gf could get some coffee and dessert. Ordered a mocha w/ only one pump of chocolate and a chocolate tart. 
The lady behind the counter really needs to enroll in som ESL classes. She didn't just mess up my girls name.....but she messed up the alphabet...we spelled out her name and she not only got every letter wrong, but there were double the letters (even though we paid with her credit card). 
The chocolate tart was ok (gf liked it), coffee was way too sweet for her (i liked it because it tasted like hot chocolate).....looks like they used a full 3 pumps and maybe one extra....regardless of taste, it wasn't what she ordered.
No seats available, so we took it w/ us.....I recommend using the notepad from your room and writing your order out if you sense a communication problem. 
I don't care how nice of a person someone is, if a job requires communication and they lack that ability...........it's the wrong job for them. HR should be ashamed.

Turkey sandwich = delicious. However, $10.50 is a little steep for a sandwich in my taste. Would rather get my sandwich fix at Earl's in PH! However, hard to complain when there isn't a food court area at The Wynn.

Chicken noodle soup is definitely an amazing cure for any rough night.

Skip the tomato soup with cheese sticks. The cheese sticks are good, but the soup tastes more like marinara sauce than soup.

4 stars for food, minus one star for priciness!

This cafe is convenient because of it's location, but it is always SUPER busy.  We have gotten food to go and coffee-based drinks here several times, and everytime we go it takes at least fifteen minutes to get through the line and pay, and another five to ten to actually receive our item.

That being said, the prices are reasonable (think expensive Starbucks), and the menu has enough options to satisfy just about anyone (adults & kids), so if you're not in a hurry, this is a solid option to grab a bite to eat or get a decent caffeine fix.  

Cheers!

No joke, when I lived in vegas I would go to the Wynn specifically with the intent of going to this coffee shop.  Best pastries in vegas.  Fantastic coffee and hot drinks.  And you're in the Wynn so there are much worse places you could spend snacking and relaxing!

My husband and I stopped in for a quick breakfast and although there is really no quick in Vegas due to lines, this one moved relatively quick since we got there so early.  If you're a late riser good luck finding a cup of coffee anywhere on the strip without standing in a line.  I grabbed a toasted bagel with cream cheese and the husband got a croissant with coffee.  Both were nothing spectacular.  Mine came cut and a little philadelphia cream cheese container.  Service was shy of a bagel shop where they actually put the cream cheese into the bagel for you.  Minimal work done by the staff; you might as well call it a cafeteria rather than a cafe.

3...really? Yes really. This generous rating is due to the two specific reasons. FIRST: the delightful staff the afternoon of 3.30.15. SECOND: The Asian chicken salad is AMAZING! It comes with this honey, sesame, IDK what but the dressing is delicious. PS...No phone orders even when you are a guest of the hotel. 
They run out of fruit cups quickly so if you see it and want it...buy it.

PS...the coffee sucks here...go to the Terrace Cafe and order there.

definitely MEH. the veggie breakfast bagel i got was so bland! it was a sesame bagel with egg whites (microwaved) and spinach. NO flavor whatsoever. the grapefruit juice i got was ok. total bill: $15. oof.

yeah, it's the wynn and yeah, it's vegas but there are so many other (better) cafes to grab a quick bite to eat. if you're in a hurry, beware! lines can get pretty long in the morning
I ordered the bbq chicken salad and it was amazing. Huge portion with so much flavor I barely even used the dressing. My coworker ordered a reuben and said it was pretty good but a bit salty.
Egg white, spinach, tomato, and mushroom bagel was pretty good. I was starving when I had it tho.

Cool relaxed place right by the casino, has quite a few options to choose from, had the prime rib sandwich one day it wasn't all that good, had a tuna croissant the next, was kinda good. It's kinda expensive but the food is enough to fill you up. Not enough seats in this place though

I eat here daily, sometimes several times a day when I stay at the Wynn and the fare has changed; it was always good but as of July 2014...is outstanding. I wish I had taken photos because the presentation is nice too but the food...it's cafe casual so I wasn't expecting more than a sandwich but their Brie mac n cheese was literally the best Mac n cheese I've ever had and I'm embarrassed to admit that I order this in really good restaurants all of the time. Anything I ate here I found myself craving later on like the Asian chicken salad or the ultra healthy non powdered or sugar coated smoothies or the chai.  My boyfriend said the prime rib sandwich was one of the absolute best and he's had a lot of sandwiches.  Only negative is that at the end of the day the dessert was a tad dry.

I ate here twice on my most recent trip to Vegas (stayed at the Encore)

Both times I had breakfast. 
First time I had an cheese/egg and ham bagel. Which was kind of bland. Not great not horrible. 

The second time I had I had a raspberry croissant and a Pom-berry lemon-aid. Both were really good. I also got a box of French macaroons which I ate later. The macaroons were also really good.

If you are going to eat here just keep in mind it is very expensive. My bf paid $2.90 for
a banana!

A nice little spot for a quick bite but like everything else at the Wynn, a bit pricey.

Cafeteria style with self seating. Conveniently located off the Wynn casino floor.

Nothing special but nothing to complain about either.

Overall 3 out of 5 stars.

The drinks there are average. There is nothing very special about the cafe. The decor was very unique but the service there is below average. The barista kinda ignored me when I tried to ask for some ice

Who doesn't live the Wynn Resort?  Everything was a hit! The seafood club sandwich, Sangria, and pancakes were awesome. But service lacked and fell short of what's to be expected from The great Wynn Las Vegas.  Still it was a good experience.

Two non-fat vanilla lattes and one chocolate croissant = $17.00.  Ouch.  No wonder there are no coffee makers in the rooms.  In her defense, the lattes were really good and the croissant was fresh and flaky.  BTW, there's a Starbucks (two, actually) across the street at the Fashion Mall.
They are open 24 hrs and their mac n cheese is bomb! Even my friend who normally does not like mac n cheese loved it. This is a go-to spot for people leaving XS and Tryst nightclubs late-night.

Long lines in the am! Its totally worth it because its the only coffee shop around...a super coffee shop on steroids to say the least! Lots of delicious looking menu items all artfully prepared...salads, pastries, sandwhiches, and even iike mac and cheese you can grab on the fly here. The coffee is awesome...you can order a drip and it tastes wonderful! I also got an espresso drink later on that was fabulous. Some of the bigger coffee chains need to take notes on this place! If there was one in seattle Id be there all the time...
This place is dumb af. We could purchase food after the pool party but we couldn't eat it cause we were in beach attire. Still fully clothed. The food sucks, and the employees are rude.

Great place to have coffee if you don't want Starbucks (which are everywhere in Vegas). 

They have custom made coffee drinks for the same price as Starbucks (Vegas hotel pricing). I had the mocha for $6. It is made with a dark chocolate sauce. It was rich and fresh tasting. They topped it with whipped cream. All drinks are served in paper cups. 

They have a variety of baked goods. Cookies are $6.  They have sandwiches.  There are about 10 tables to sit at. You can watch people walk through the casino.

What craziness it was trying to grab a bite to eat with only an hour and a half to spare. We were wanting to eat before going to Mystere and the wait for the Wynn buffet was 4 hours and even their cafe had a 45 minute wait. So we decided to grab something from this self serve cafe just so we don't pass out before the show.

We got a salmon and bagel platter -- you can choose between several types of bagels: multigrain, plain, cinnamon etc -- a tomato and mozarella salad and a ham and provolone sandwich. Our total was around $35. Okay so it wasn't cheap considering what we got, however, the bagel was toasted and the 3 slices of salmon were pretty big, plus it came with a few caperberries and a tub of cream cheese. I was a little surprised as the salmon looked small but it was all rolled up and when you unroll them, they were big.

The salad was okay, didn't impress me much and while the ham and provolone tasted fine, the bread was cold. If it had also been toasted, that sandwich would've been awesome.

Service was fast, but when there are a lot of people, it can be a bitch trying to find a place to sit. 

For a fast food type of establishment, the food was great, but then, would you expect anything less from Wynn?

I hit up the Drugstore Caf√© late at night.  They have a solid menu and the prices are much better than a lot of the other options at Wynn.  I had the quiche Lorraine, which was enormous for the price, around $8.50 as I recall.  Even if the line is long, they get through it pretty quickly and get the food out to you quickly as well.  They are clearly just heating stuff up back there, and my quiche was cold in the middle.  This cost the Caf√© a star, I would give it 4 stars otherwise based on the price and service.

The quiche itself was good, very flaky crust and lots of ham.  The eggs were fluffy, but like I said, it was noticeable that it was heated up in the back.

Overall, a very solid place that is open 24 hours.  You won't be wowed, but you probably won't be disappointed either.

I know you can't find cheap food in the Wynn and this is probably the cheapest food you'll find but this place is really expensive for the portion.

You'll spend $10+ easily for just a snack to expect to order 2 to be satisfied. The food here is fairly good, however. The tuna croissant sandwich does not disappoint. The ham and cheese is really, really good and comes with a great sauce but it'll disappear in a few quick bites.

The place is conveniently located close to guest elevators and on the casino shop floor.

Small cafe inside the Wynn Hotel.  You wait in line, then order and pay when it is your turn.  The staff is friendly and quick with their service.

One mid-morning, we decided to get some food here.  I ordered the Asian Chicken Salad ($9.95) and it comes with the Asian dressing inside the TO-GO container.  We also got a bagel with cream cheese, a fruit cup, and an OJ.

After you order, you wait by the counter for your food, then find an open table to sit and eat!

My Asian Chicken salad was very good.  It's a good size portion for the money and I really enjoyed the dressing for the salad.

The OJ and fruit cup were very good as well.  

If you need something quick in the morning, try the Cafe at the Wynn.  

Xie Xie!!
Being a Vegan it's hard to find a place that understands my eating habits. I'm very happy to say that "the Cafe" at the Wynn gets it. Try the vegan tuna croissant for breakfast.

Arrived to the Wynn pretty late at night, I was tired and wanted something quick to eat so, I checked out The Cafe.

They offered some great sandwiches, salads and desserts.  I orderd their Chicken Portabella sandwich.  I was a little put off that the sandwich was not made fresh, rather it was refrigerated, popped in an oven and served to you.  For $11.00 I would've expected a little more freshness.  But, I spread some of the Garlic Aioili it was served with, took a bite into it and it was very delish.  Add a bottle of Coke for $4.00 (ouch!) and I was good for the night.

The Cafe gets pretty busy in the morning for those that need that caffeine fix so, early bird gets the worm.  (IMO, take a morning stroll and walk over to Starbucks across the street at Fashion Show Mall.)

Grabbed coffee here before a show. Cool little spot; wish there was more seating. Food and pastries looked fresh and awesome. Our lattes were very hot, very tasty. They served us quickly and with a smile. Pricey, but it's the Wynn for cryin out loud.

Cool gift shop adjacent, for browsing with your fresh cup of whatever, since you probably won't find a table if its busy, haha!

Do NOT get the cupcakes!  They were dry and disgusting. Even the frosting was a complete failure.  How do you screw up a cupcake this bad?  How?  

The blended coffee drinks were ok, and the only other redeeming quality of this place is that it's open 24 hours.  So when it's 4 am and you're desperate for a snack, this place is a step up from the vending machine.

Open 24 hours. Service at the register is pretty slow but the food is very good. The asian chicken salad is really tasty, the cookies are delicious. I really wanted to try their other desserts but didn't get too. I would next time I am here.

We were walking around playing tourist and needed a little bit of a break to sit down and wanted something to satiate the sweet tooth. We saw this cafe and the family decided to drop through. 

I got a cafe caramelle w/ soy and it was properly made. Not too sweet, nice quality coffee. I see they use Simonelli machines so I expected a good hot beverage. 

The desserts looked pretty and I couldn't decide so I asked the girl helping me what her favorite was and I will roll with that. The pumpkin cheesecake she suggested was actually a solid suggestion. It was light, had just a very light hint of pumpkin and spice in the center, the outer layer was plain. The whipped cream was dotted with vanilla bean and the chocolate garnish with pumpkin seeds was nice. I tried a bite of different desserts my family got and they were all good - with the tiramisu and the peanut butter cup being favorites. The cheesecake was my favorite so I was glad I got it. 

It's a quick and easy option for a little snack and a good latte that's open 24/7. I'd definitely drop back in here and I'm glad that the Wynn didn't go corporate and just have a same ol' Starbucks whose jetfuel coffee does not agree with me.

It's unfortunate the Wynn couldn't just go corporate and get a freaking Starbucks or Coffee Bean and Tea Leaf. This place had all the charm and character of a no-name airport coffee place with sad packaged foods in a refrigerated case. My caramel macciato knock-off wasn't terrible but left much to be desired...

Items Selected:
Magic Cookie Bar - Coconut, Caramel, Shortbread, Chocolate, Pretzels
Almond Croissant
Frosted Cinnamon Roll

After a truly an enjoyable breakfast bathed in the warm sunshine of immense windows and high ceilings it was admittedly with some regret that we neglected to taste any of Terrace Point's pastries but returning later that day after a bit of Fashion Show shopping I opted to make amends at grab-and-go sister, Drugstore Caf√© - a trio of three items proving equally competent to that served in the dining room with both a decadent brioche cinnamon roll and rich "magic" cookie bar proving delicious and slightly superior to the twice-baked almond croissant; a shattering shell and great texture marred by just a bit too much sweet frangipane; a good choice for the strip but a far cry from Bonjour or Sugar Bee's for city's best.

When I stayed in the Wynn, there were only two restaurants that we could affford in our price range and that was the Drugstore cafe and The Buffet and then maybe splurge on a $$$ restaurant. :P

The buffet is conveniently located in the lobby right by the resort elevators, so when me and my friend wanted something quick and not too pricey. We would eat here knowing the portions are a good size and the price is somewhat but not too expensive considering it's the Wynn on par with the Bellagio but more modernized.

We ordered ordered 2 orange juice, 2 muffins and 2 panini's and the price total would come up to over $30 but to me it's not bad for the price and the if you ordered the same stuff at Society Cafe, it would've been over $50!

It's connected right by the drugstore and carries all your necessities for travel and some affordable souvenirs to bring home. Next to the drugstore is the bath and body section that sells highend products that you can only find in a department store like Bloomingdales and most of the products are from London. They have something for males and females so no one is left out and the pricing is a bit on the pricey side but you do get what you pay for. I for sure loved the Jo Malone products for men and just fell in love with the scents and you can't find those anywhere and not even Macys carries them. Customer service was always friendly and are always there to answer questions about their products.

Nice cafe and the coffee is good as well as the apple pastries.  Good location between the Wynn and Encore.  Not what I would call a high end specialty coffee shop by any means.  Paper cups only and plastic plates.  A notch above Starbucks and a nice place to sit.  Shame with a La Marzocco espresso machine and nice setting they do the paper cup thing.  Could be a lot nicer experience.  
But it's a good place to relax and get some quick food and drinks.

$12 for a mediocre sandwich. I feel like I was ripped off...

Walked around a bit and found The Cafe at Wynn. They had your typical european inspired sandwiches and such but I opted for the prime rib. 

Man, the texture massivly unpleasant. The bread was mushy in the middle and cardboard-like on the outer edges. The prime rib itself was mushy. Flavor was disappointing as well. What a waste of $12 and a waste of prime rib... 

The high level of mediocrity in that sandwich did not justify a $12 price tag. They should improve the quality of their food. If not, they are only a few notches above Arby's. Maybe they should consider lowering the price a bit and creating a value meal menu instead of tricking me into believing my meal would be halfway decent.
